alert.note: Alert for Geneva; Henry; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 26 at 5:20PM CDT until March 26 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... South central Henry County in southeastern Alabama... Northeastern Geneva County in southeastern Alabama... Houston County in southeastern Alabama... Southwestern Early County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 645 PM EDT/545 PM CDT/. * At 620 PM EDT/520 PM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located over Taylor, or near Dothan, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Cottonwood, Dothan, Taylor, Ashford, Cowarts, Webb, Columbia, Kinsey, Malvern, Rehobeth, Avon, Madrid, Gordon, Memphis, Saffold, Pansey, Garretts Crossroads, Sigma, Enon and Wilson Mill. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
